column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 99 of 124”
Table: 91
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION

column1: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column2: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
column3: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd)
Construct indoor pool addition to the existing community
center.
Construct a state-of-the-art 20,000 square foot, full-service
branch library facility with increased space for collections
display, public computing, individual and group study,
tutoring, programming and public meetings.
Install bulkheads and/or retaining walls along the Hampton
River which runs through the course. Included in this estimate
are the costs for regulatory permits, design and inspections.
Remove and replace deteriorated asphalt in the parking lot.
Overlay four miles of cart paths.
Completely renovate all 18 greens and the practice putting
green with new bent grass.
TOTAL: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support
Acquire land along Armistead Avenue (west side of Armistead
Avenue bordered by Heffelfinger Street, Back River Road and
Interstate 64) to facilitate the Master Plan's recommendations
for the area.
Develop plans to restore Bright's Creek to an urban greenway
and City-wide amenity. A new in-town neighborhood is to be
developed between Downtown and the northern edge of the
greenway. A high quality commercial development is to be
created between Interstate-64 and the northern edge of the
greenway.
Anticipated funds needed for property acquisition and
demolition in the Atlantic Avenue area.
Establish Buckroe Avenue as the community's main street by
improving public areas along Buckroe Avenue between
Mallory and First Streets.
Reposition the Buckroe Shopping Center.
